nodes.bodyText: We prefer to avoid lambdas and method references in here for pure performance reasons. And yes, I know it sucks :)
I am thinking of wether to add a default value here, values can be taken from AddressResolverOptions.DEFAULT_CACHE_MAX_TIME_TO_LIVE This is mainly for the generated docs.
you mean a default value within the ConfigItem annotation?
Ok, I'll add default values as defined by AddressResolverOptions

Can you describe (with words) what does the default value represent?
It seems to be "forever"
I assumed so already and have pushed a corresponding change ...
I don't think you need to specify a default value here for any of these attributes, since you're already handling that in the recorder class
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@ +package io.quarkus.vertx.core.runtime.config; + +import java.util.OptionalInt; + +import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigGroup; +import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigItem; + +@ConfigGroup +public class AddressResolverConfiguration { + + /** + * The maximum amount of time in seconds that a successfully resolved address will be cached. + *

+ * If not set explicitly, resolved addresses may be cached forever. + */ + @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "2147483647")

nodes.bodyText: Hi @gastaldi this is purely for the generated doc as suggested in my feedback here #13238 (comment)

nodes.bodyText:
@machi1990 ah sorry, I missed that.
In this case you don't need the types to be optional, just use int directly
